top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

A) Never *ever* pay rent in cash. Avoid any professional organization that accepts cash for rent. It’s physically dangerous for the organization and the only reason to do so is that the property manager is lazy or stealing.

B) Insist on a receipt. Much easier, more normal, and immediately demonstrable in court.
I would never pay rent (or really for anything) in cash unless I was given a receipt at the same time I handed it over.

Don't know why any landlord would accept cash these days unless they were dodgy AF and I don't know anyone who uses cheques anymore.

My rent goes through via standing order. I have online banking so I just screenshot it when it has been paid.
It won't help you to do this. Your landlord will just say nobody knows what's in that envelope, and you'll have no proof. Just get a receipt; it's easier and is proof of payment.
